intro: Clibadium pediculatum, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes other nettle species known for their stinging hairs. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
